tweets.hook: ðŸš¨ Dilution watch on $AMZE. Ripped +91%, still up +47%, but a fresh ATM hit on 2025-11-13. ~$2.8M micro-cap, almost no cash, survival depends on selling shares into strength. Elevated risk profile here. Full breakdown below â†“
breakdown: 1/ What's an ATM? Company files to sell new shares at market through a broker. They usually hit the bid during spikes so they can raise more cash. More shares sold â†’ more supply â†’ price often bleeds while they fund operations.

2/ The $AMZE setup:
â€¢ Micro-cap: ~$2.8M
â€¢ ATM filed: 2025-11-13
â€¢ Move: +91% peak â†’ now +47%
â€¢ Cash: $300K
â€¢ Burn: $2.0M/month
â€¢ Runway: < 1 month
They already raised $4.6M last quarter via stock. High price + urgent cash need = dilution setup.

3/ Confirming signals to watch on $AMZE:
â€¢ Heavy red candle with big volume
â€¢ Persistent selling into strength
â€¢ Support breaks that do not bounce
â€¢ Already ~45% off the highs
Motive is clear: critical distress, ATM is a survival tool, not optional.

4/ Scenarios:
Bear builds if:
â€¢ Red candle + volume spike
â€¢ Price cannot reclaim recent highs
â€¢ ATM usage shows up in filings or tape

Bull invalidation:
â€¢ Strong breakout on real volume, absorbs selling.

Traders get trapped when dilution hits during the pullback, not the run.

5/ Final takeaway on $AMZE:
Tiny cap, critical cash crunch, fresh ATM, and a recent spike. Company has every reason to sell shares into any strength to stay alive. That creates elevated dilution risk. Not advice â€” pattern recognition only. ðŸ¦…
